container-title: 12.2.30). Teresa Morgan, Literate Education in the Hellenistic and Roman Worlds
title: Morgan points out that the Greek educational system relied on traditional literature more heavily than the Roman system did. Roman education also involved gnomic maxims, but the Romans were also interested in looking to the examples of great men of the past for instruction. So Quintilian claims, ‘‘Strong as the Greeks are in precepts, the Romans are as strong in examples, which is better’
